message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.CR, cs.COM. 

The paper deals with the design of a random access protocol for visible light communication (VLC) systems, which is a subfield of networked systems and communication (cs.NI). The paper also involves the optimization of the protocol's performance, which falls under information theory (cs.IT). The use of successive interference cancellation (SIC) algorithm and multi-packet reception (MPR) capability in the proposed protocol involves signal processing and multimedia (cs.MM). The paper also deals with the problem of collisions in VLC systems, which is a security and cryptography issue (cs.CR). Finally, the paper proposes a distributed algorithm for the random access protocol, which falls under computer networking and internet architecture (cs.COM).
